variant.question: Plotting positions in charts by Dead Reckoning (DR) may be required...

options.text: during a flight with limited equipment and few navigational aids.
during a flight over sea using INS/IRS and GPS navigation.
when any of the radio-navigation, INS or GPS sources are unavailable.
in areas with high densities of airways and navigation aids.

The main purpose of DR navigation is to...

options.text: obtain, with reasonable accuracy, the aircraft’s position between fixes or in the absence of fixes.
improve the accuracy of GPS positions.
obtain, with reasonable accuracy, the aircrafts position between IRS fixes.

The Wind Correction Angle...

options.text: Will be established whenever a crosswind is experienced and desired track is kept.
All three answers above are correct.
Will arise whenever the drift is changing during a flight along a fixed track.
Is the angle in distance between the desired track and the track made good.

options.text: heading line corrected by the actual drift.
desired track corrected by the track error.
actual track corrected by the track error.

options.text: The difference between the actual wind and the forecasted wind.
The difference between no-wind and the forecasted wind.
The difference between no-wind and the actual wind.
The difference between the magnetic and the true wind direction.
